welcome_message:
ğŸ‘‹ Hello {name}! Welcome to the GitHub README Generator Bot!

I'll help you create a professional GitHub README.md file from your voice or text input.

Here's how it works:
1. ğŸ“ Tell me your name and basic info
2. ğŸ¤ Send a voice message or text about your experience
3. ğŸ¤– I'll extract and structure your information
4. ğŸ“„ Generate a beautiful README with Devicon icons
5. ğŸ“¦ Get it as a ZIP file ready for GitHub!

Ready to start? Let's begin with your name:
help_title: ğŸ“– How to Use This Bot
help_steps:
1. Start: Click "Let's Start!" to begin
2. Name: Tell me your full name
3. Your GitHub username: Share your GitHub username
4. Links (optional): LinkedIn, Portfolio, Email
5. Voice/Text: Send a voice message ğŸ¤ or text ğŸ“ describing:
   â€¢ Your experience and background
   â€¢ Technical skills and programming languages
   â€¢ Tools and platforms you use
   â€¢ Projects you've worked on

6. Review: I'll show you the extracted information
7. Confirm: Approve and get your README.md file
help_tips:
ğŸ’¡ Tips:
â€¢ Speak clearly and include specific technologies
â€¢ Mention frameworks, databases, and tools
â€¢ The more detail you provide, the better your README
â€¢ Voice messages work best for natural descriptions

ğŸ”§ Supported Languages:
Python, JavaScript, React, Docker, Git, AWS, and many more!

Ready? Click "Let's Start!" below!

contact_edit_prompt:
âœï¸ Edit Contact Information

Please send your updated information in this format:

Name: Your Full Name
GitHub: github-username  
LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/in/your-profile
Portfolio: https://your-website.com
Email: your.email@example.com

You can send only the fields you want to update. For example:
```
Name: John Doe
GitHub: johndoe
```

Send /cancel to go back.
tech_stack_prompt:
ğŸ”§ Add Tech Stack Items

Please send additional technologies, tools, or skills you want to add:

Examples:
- Programming languages: python, javascript, typescript, go, rust
- Frameworks: react, vue, angular, django, flask
- Tools: docker, kubernetes, git, aws, azure
- Databases: mysql, postgresql, mongodb, redis
- Other: power bi, tableau, jupyter

You can send them as a comma-separated list:
```
react, typescript, docker, aws, postgresql
```

Send /cancel to go back.
cancel_message:
âŒ README Generation Cancelled

If you'd like to try again, just send /start to begin a new conversation!
deploy_intro_text:
ğŸš€ GitHub Auto-Deployment

To do this, we need a Personal Access Token with the following scopes:
1. `repo` (Full control of private/public repositories)
2. `workflow` (Update GitHub Action workflows)

How to get it?
1. Go to GitHub Settings > Developer settings
2. Select Personal access tokens > Tokens (classic)
3. Create a new Token and select the required scopes (`repo`, `workflow`)
4. Copy the Token and send it here ğŸ‘‡

ğŸ”— You can get it directly from here:
https://github.com/settings/tokens

âš ï¸ Note: We do NOT store your Token. It's used once for deployment and then immediately forgotten for your security.

Send the Token now or send /cancel to cancel.
